intro: Neophloga majorana, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that resemble small umbrellas. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features feathery, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Neophloga majorana is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it has been used traditionally in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
